title: KupaCrypto
author: KupaCrypto
content: Distribution of weitin we dey carry vote wey dey call PVC dey on, if you no get and you been register,  Wait no more!   Just go your local government council go collect am , as you dey go carry your NIN or any other form of identification join body so them go dey sure say na you get the PVC, Election done dey close and make we try make sure say our votes them count, your vote is your voice, them no dey win election for social media na fir polling unit dem they win election,. So make we go collect our permanent voters card so we fit vote anybody wey we know say em go take Nigeria forward.

comments.author: HajiBagi
comments.body: Thank you for the information my brother, this your information wey you pass now get sense because they get some people wey don do their pvc wey never collect am up to now and some people no be say they forget oo they no forget but some people na laziness and some still they think say even if they go collect the pvc and they vote after all the person wey dey vote for go still forget them they treat them bad but my advice be say make we no think that for mind because no be all of them get mind to do treat us bad but as he be one yam don spoiled the rest, so my brothers na we get time to control now make we get pvc and choose our favorite person.

comments.author: Davidvictorson
comments.body: Time don reach although the latest news now be say the Independent National Electoral Commission (INEC) don extend the deadline for the collection of Permanent Voters Cards (PVCs) till Sunday 29th, January 2023. E make sense. I like am because the previous date nor been dey feasible at all. I been wan ask those people wey change polling unit - like from one state to another. Would they need to go to INEC's office to collect a new card?

comments.author: Merit.s
comments.body: It is time for those of us that have not collected our PVC to so that, to enable you participate in this year's election to vote out bad leaders. I have gotten my and I hope everybody will do the same. Thank God say INEC don extend the time to 29th of this month, election na the only way for the people to vote their choice of government into power so I beg make we no take am for granted, if not na anoda 8yrs of lamenting and suffering na e we won put for we head.

comments.author: Asiska02
comments.body: Quote from: Davidvictorson on January 12, 2023, 08:09:02 PMTime don reach although the latest news now be say the Independent National Electoral Commission (INEC) don extend the deadline for the collection of Permanent Voters Cards (PVCs) till Sunday 29th, January 2023. E make sense. I like am because the previous date nor been dey feasible at all.The collection of permanent voters card extension was very necessary because many people are yet to collect theirs due to large populations at INEC’s office, they had to send some voters card to respective polling unit for local government for collection. Even at that, some PVC’s are not yet ready for some voters to collect and they’re asking them to check back on a later date. QuoteI been wan ask those people wey change polling unit - like from one state to another. Would they need to go to INEC's office to collect a new card?Since there was no option where to collect your new voters card during registration, I think they need to go to the state dey deployed to in order to collect their PVC. INEC won’t keep your voters card in a state you won’t vote in.

comments.author: Fivestar4everMVP
comments.body: I never vote before for my life, Infact, I follow for people wey been always dey talk say "nothing go ever concern me concern voting, voting na their business", but wetin me don use my eye see for this country in the last 8 years don make me change my mind, immediately inec open voters card registration last year, I get up, drag my wife follow body, both of us go do the voters registration, as I dey type like this, me and my wife don collect our PVC, and we are both ready to make our vote count come this February - Nigeria must be great again.

comments.author: sokani
comments.body: INEC: Extends deadline for PVC collection to 5th februaryQuoteArising from reports from the various States and discussions with Resident Electoral Commissioners, the Commission has decided to further extend PVC collection in all its Local Government Offices nationwide by an additional one week. The ongoing collection of PVCs nationwide will therefore continue and end on 5th February 2023,” Okoye said in a statement on Saturday.“This is the second time the Commission is extending PVC collection nationwide and this will be the last extension of the exercise. The collection period has further been extended by an additional two hours and will start at 9 am and end at 5 pm daily including Saturdays and Sundays.”Source: https://www.channelstv.com/2023/01/28/just-in-inec-extends-pvc-collection-deadline/This one na good news ooo as many persons never still collect their PVCs, so this extension make sense as e give electorates more time to get their voters cards and prepare themselves for the forthcoming elections. But that one no mean say make we relax because according to this informent, dem no go extend am again.

QuoteThe Independent National Electoral Commission (INEC) has extended the deadline for the collection of Permanent Voter Cards (PVCs) to February 5, 2023. sourceWith this development, People have an extra week to get their PVC to vote the candidate of their choice. This is very impressive from INEC, choosing to extend the date because If they had not done so, many eligible voters would have been denied their rights to vote and that will be widely seen as a move by INEC to favor some candidates that know that they can only win by rigging the election.
